Data: Toss, 9.00 am Shane Watson has won the toss and Australia are going to bat.
Roach to Watson, no run good length angling into the right-hander from over the wicket, Watson strides forward and across to play towards square leg
Roach to Watson, no run short of a length and straight, Watson gets behind the line and blocks
Roach to Watson, FOUR runs a fuller ball and Watson pushes forward to defend but gets an outside edge to the third man boundary, that went along the ground past second slip
Roach to Watson, no run defended from the crease back down the pitch
Roach to Watson, no run played off the back foot on the off side
Roach to Watson, 1 run a short ball, Watson tries to pull but doesn't middle it, the ball lobs towards midwicket

Bravo to Watson, no run a confident appeal for lbw first up but the umpire says not out. Darren Sammy has asked for a review. The ball had nipped into the right-hander from a good length just outside off and beat the front-foot drive. Replays are taking a while and when we finally have them they indicate that the impact on the pad was marginally outside off st
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, Watson frees those powerful arms and cuts hard over the leaping fielder at point
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs this time he drives powerfully, and finds the gap at cover, consecutive boundaries
Bravo to Watson, no run driven on the front foot to mid-on
Bravo to Watson, 1 wide short ball and far down leg side, that's the first extra of the day
Bravo to Watson, no run defended on the front foot once again

Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs that's too full on the pads and Watson helps himself to a third boundary in the over, whipping behind square after moving on to the front foot. He could have nearly been dismissed, but has collected 12 runs instead
Roach to Warner, no run Warner gets a terrific ball first up, pitching on a good length and seaming across the left-hander at serious pace. Warner pushed at it from the crease and was beaten
Roach to Warner, 1 run straighter line, on the pads, and Warner works it behind square
Roach to Watson, no run short of a length outside off, Watson defends towards point
Roach to Watson, no run fuller ball outside off, Watson strides forward and drives to cover
Roach to Watson, no run Watson moves forward again and drives towards mid-on, Roach is keeping the ball on tight lines and lengths
Roach to Watson, 1 run Watson drives straight and Russell runs to his left from mid-on and dives to prevent the boundary
Bravo to Watson, 1 run Watson stays back and cuts a short of a length delivery towards third man, that bounced a bit but Watson controlled his shot
Bravo to Warner, no run another ball kicks off a good length, Warner stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
Bravo to Warner, no run Warner plays back to one that was too full to play back to, he prods and gets beaten as the ball seams across him
Bravo to Warner, 1 run Warner gets squared up as he tries to defend and the thick outside edge goes towards third man
Bravo to Watson, 1 wide that's another wide down leg side, two in as many overs for Bravo
Bravo to Watson, no run short of a length outside off, Watson punches on the back foot to cover
Bravo to Watson, no run Watson strides forward and pushes towards cover
Roach to Warner, no run Warner drives at a fullish ball from his crease and the fielder at cover can't make a clean stop after diving to his right
Roach to Warner, no run another full ball angling across Warner, who drives hard but to the man at cover
Roach to Warner, 1 run the length is a bit shorter and Warner pushes off the back foot, playing the ball towards third man
Roach to Watson, no run that ball has taken off steeply from just short of a length, Watson began to play at it but then dropped his gloves in the nick of time
Roach to Watson, 1 run played towards third man for a single
Roach to Warner, no run Warner gets behind the line of a length ball and defends towards the bowler
Bravo to Watson, 1 run with Roach bowling well, the batsmen seem to be targeting Bravo, Watson swivels and pulls a length ball in front of square
Bravo to Warner, no run Warner goes back to a good length delivery and blocks
Bravo to Warner, 2 runs short of a length outside off, Warner goes back and punches the ball through cover point
Bravo to Warner, no run played off the back foot towards cover
Bravo to Warner, no run Warner has width to work with but he cuts the ball into the ground and to the fielder at point
Bravo to Warner, 1 run played off the back foot into the gap at midwicket, just a tap, not a powerful shot
Roach to Warner, no run Warner's tried to pull a short of a length ball from outside off stump. He makes contact, but it isn't good contact, and doesn't beat midwicket
Roach to Warner, no run driven off the front foot but to the man at cover
Roach to Warner, no run played with absolutely no feet movement towards mid-on, Warner's struggling for fluency against Roach
Roach to Warner, 2 runs short of a length on the pads, now he can work the ball off the back foot through square
Roach to Warner, no run a full toss and Warner can't put it away, hitting it from his crease to cover
Roach to Warner, no run Warner jumps back to play a good length ball towards midwicket. Roach's pace and length is keeping Warner away from the front foot

Bravo to Watson, OUT this time the umpire's given Watson lbw and Australia have asked for a review. It's quite similar to the appeal in Bravo's first over, which the umpire said was not out and West Indies reviewed unsuccessfully. Watson came half-forward to a delivery that nipped into him off the pitch. He was beaten on the front-foot defence and hit in front
Bravo to Forrest, no run short of a length and straight, Forrest stands tall in his crease and plays the ball down on the leg side
Bravo to Forrest, no run Bravo tests the new boy with a bouncer, Forrest begins to fend but then lets it go
Bravo to Forrest, no run played from the crease on the leg side
Bravo to Forrest, no run good length around off stump, Forrest pushes towards cover
Bravo to Forrest, no run beaten outside the off stump
Russell to Warner, FOUR runs Warner stays back to the relatively slower pace and uses the width outside off to punch through point and release some pressure
Russell to Warner, 1 wide a wide down leg side, the third of the innings
Russell to Warner, 2 runs Warner stays back to a length ball and whips it off his pads through midwicket
Russell to Warner, no run defended from the crease on the leg side
Russell to Warner, FOUR runs short of a length and straight, Warner jumps back and simply swats it with power through midwicket

Russell to Warner, FOUR runs Warner continues the merry-making after Roach's removal from the attack, he stays back and flays his bat at a length ball angling into him, the fielder at cover dives to take some pace off the ball, but it still reaches the boundary
Russell to Warner, 1 run pulled off the back foot towards fine leg
Bravo to Warner, no run Warner tries to pull again but doesn't make proper contact. It wasn't short enough
Bravo to Warner, no run length ball outside off, Warner stays in his crease and cuts towards point
Bravo to Warner, no run fuller length but wide outside off, Warner stays back and throws his bat at it, bottom-edging the ball into the ground towards the keeper
Bravo to Warner, FOUR runs too short, the ball sat up for Warner and he dismissed it to the midwicket boundary with a powerful pull, hit flat over the in field
Bravo to Warner, no run fuller length and Warner drives from his crease to mid-off

Bravo to Warner, no run huge appeal for lbw, but the umpire says not out. That definitely hit the batsmen plumb in front but it might have pitched outside leg. West Indies have no reviews left. Warner played back to a full ball, moving across his crease to whip on the leg side. The impact was not high as well, but the ball pitched outside leg stump.
Sammy to Forrest, no run length ball outside off, driven to mid-off
Sammy to Forrest, no run defended on the front foot, Sammy is bowling wicket to wicket
Sammy to Forrest, no run Forrest gets behind the line of a good length delivery and blocks
Sammy to Forrest, no run a fuller ball on the pads, Forrest stays back and clips to the fielder at midwicket
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run pushed into a gap at cover point for a quick single
Sammy to Warner, no run the slower ball around off stump, Warner drives from his crease and Pollard swoops on the ball at point
Narine to Forrest, no run Forrest plays from his crease and gets beaten by one that spins into him, hitting the pad
Narine to Forrest, no run tossed up on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
Narine to Forrest, no run quicker ball on a straight line, played back to the bowler from the crease
Narine to Forrest, no run quicker but on leg stump this time, Forrest pulls to short fine leg
Narine to Forrest, no run slower through the air on middle, Forrest stays back and defends towards square leg
Narine to Forrest, 1 run a full ball on middle, this time Forrest drives to long-on for a single
Sammy to Forrest, FOUR runs that's too short, at that pace on this pitch, Forrest pulls through midwicket and hits his first boundary
Sammy to Forrest, no run fuller length on off stump, Forrest pushes towards the off side and wants a single, Sammy is quick to prevent it
Sammy to Forrest, no run short of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot
Sammy to Forrest, FOUR runs too wide outside off, short of a length as well, Forrest stays back and cuts behind point and in front of third man. No room for medium-pace errors on this pitch
Sammy to Forrest, no run defended on the back foot once again to point
Sammy to Forrest, no run short of a length and straight, Forrest defends on the back foot
Narine to Warner, 1 run Narine gives width outside off, Warner goes back to cut towards deep point
Narine to Forrest, no run that was the doosra, going away from the right-hander, Forrest defended it on the back foot
Narine to Forrest, no run the straighter one hits Forrest high on the back leg as he tries to defend
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the back foot
Narine to Forrest, FOUR runs short with width outside off, Forrest sees an opportunity and cashes in, cutting off the back foot in front of point
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the front foot
Sammy to Warner, no run Warner stays back to a good length ball and punches towards cover
Sammy to Warner, no run a full ball in the blockhole, it was also the slower ball, Warner dug it out on the off side
Sammy to Warner, no run short of a length outside off, Warner slaps at it but can't beat Pollard at point
Sammy to Warner, 1 run swatted towards deep square leg for a single
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run a full toss, Forrest taps towards long on. It was a slower full toss.
Sammy to Warner, no run another slower ball, all around 104 kph, Warner plays towards cover
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the back foot, that ball spun into the right-hander rather sharply
Narine to Forrest, 1 wide this time the spin takes the ball far down leg side, Baugh does well to collect
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the leg side
Narine to Forrest, no run Forrest goes back to turn the offbreak off his pads to short fine leg
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the off side off the back foot
Narine to Forrest, 1 run Sammy dives to his left at square leg to cut off the shot after Forrest turned it off his pads with the spin
Narine to Warner, no run Warner stays back to one that pitches in line with the stumps and spins sharply across him, he gets beaten
Sammy to Forrest, no run good length and angling towards off and middle, Forrest stays in his crease and gets squared up while defending on the off side
Sammy to Forrest, no run Forrest stays on the back foot once again and blocks
Sammy to Forrest, no run he closed the face too early to a full ball angling into his pads and got a leading edge towards extra cover

Sammy to Forrest, 2 runs that's not that short but Forrest moves back and across in a flash, pulling with power from outside off towards deep midwicket, where Dwayne Bravo has to slide to save the four
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run the slower ball outside off, Forrest plays the drive early and spoons the shot in the air but short of mid-off

Sammy to Warner, no run that's in the air but short of the fielder diving forward at cover. Warner stayed in his crease and pushed too early at a short of a length slower ball, the ball lobbed off the bat face but dropped a foot in front of the fielder
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the front foot
Narine to Forrest, no run Forrest moves back and across to defend the offbreak on the leg side
Narine to Forrest, no run the quicker, straighter ball. Forrest defends on the back foot
Narine to Forrest, 1 run worked off the pads behind square leg
Narine to Warner, no run Warner cuts off the back foot but can't beat backward point
Narine to Warner, no run Warner moves forward and opens the face to guide the ball to backward point
Sammy to Forrest, no run good length just outside off, Forrest stays in his crease and defends on the off side
Sammy to Forrest, no run defended on the back foot towards the bowler
Sammy to Forrest, no run Bravo intercepts the push off the front foot at short extra cover and fires the throw in at the bowler's end, forcing the non-striker to hurry back to beat the direct hit
Sammy to Forrest, no run good length delivery angling into the right-hander, Forrest moves back and plays to midwicket
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run nudged towards midwicket for a quick single, he moved across his crease to tap that from outside off
Sammy to Warner, 1 run Warner moves back and hits the ball through point
Narine to Warner, 1 run Warner goes back and cuts the ball with the spin towards deep point where Russell is quick to cover ground and prevent the second
Narine to Forrest, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Narine to Warner, 1 run tossed up on middle stump, Warner strides forward and drives to long off
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the back foot, Forrest was hurried by that straighter one
Narine to Forrest, no run Forrest gets drawn into the front-foot drive outside off and is beaten
Narine to Forrest, no run defended back to the bowler
Sammy to Warner, 1 run short and wide, but doesn't time the cut shot into the covers
Sammy to Forrest, no run back of a length on off stump, defended to the off side
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run nicely bowled, squares him up a touch as the ball straightens to take an outside edge down to third man
Sammy to Warner, no run beaten outside off as he tries to guide down to third man, a slower ball that gripped a little on the surface
Sammy to Warner, FOUR runs dragged down short and this time Warner latches on as he pulls it from outside off over deep midwicket
Sammy to Warner, 1 run now he cuts through point out to the sweeper
Samuels to Warner, 1 run waits on the back foot, opens the face and places into square on the off side

Samuels to Forrest, no run close! Almost gives a return catch. It was a loopy delivery from Samuels and Forrest played a fraction early which sent a leading edge back towards the bowler but it dropped a few inches short
Samuels to Forrest, no run defended on the front foot
Samuels to Forrest, no run beaten outside off by one that goes on straight
Samuels to Forrest, no run tries to play a straight delivery to leg but it squirts into the off side
Samuels to Forrest, 1 run touch shorter outside off, Forrest on the back foot and pushes down to long on. Good start from Samuels
Sammy to Forrest, no run maintains a probing line on off stump and it's defended into the covers
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run a slower ball which comes out very loopy from Sammy and it's pulled into the leg side
Sammy to Warner, 1 run worked through the off side out to the cover sweeper
Sammy to Forrest, no run back of a length and defended to the leg side
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run full at the stumps, pushed firmly down to long-on
Sammy to Warner, no run onto the front foot, drives with an open face and has to stop the shot a little so it doesn't go in the air to cover
Samuels to Forrest, no run quicker and flatter to start the over, spearing towards leg stump and tucked to midwicket
Samuels to Forrest, OUT breakthrough for West Indies. Forrest's struggles are over. He came down the pitch and the ball beat the outside to provide Baugh the chance of a simple stumping.
Samuels to Hussey, no run full at off stump and driven to cover
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run touch shorter, it turns a fraction and Hussey opens the face towards backward point
Samuels to Warner, no run full at middle stump and pushed back to the bowler

Samuels to Warner, OUT gone! Superb catch from Pollard and two in the over for Samuels. Warner punched it off the back foot and Pollard flung himself low to his left at cover to grab it inches from the turf. Anything in the air near Pollard is always dangerous, he's an incredible fielder.
Roach to Hussey, 3 runs starts on leg stump and it's neatly flicked in front of square...extra pace on the ball already helping
Roach to Hussey, no run good length on off stump, defended to the off side
Roach to Hussey, no run banged in a touch shorter, keeps Hussey on the back foot as he defends at the top of the bounce
Roach to Hussey, no run staying parked on the back foot but this is a touch fuller and is played square on the off side

Roach to Hussey, 1 leg bye wow, where did that come from? An excellent bouncer from Roach which really climbed and took Hussey on the shoulder as he tried to sway out of the line. Baugh took the catch and West Indies were confident, but a good decision from umpire Dharmasena
Roach to Hussey, 1 run pushed into the off side
Samuels to Hussey, 2 runs worked from middle and leg into the on side
Samuels to Hussey, no run leans forward and defends to the covers
Samuels to Hussey, no run played square into the covers
Samuels to Hussey, no run full at the stumps and pushed back to the bowler...good pressure being built
Samuels to Hussey, no run another dot ball as Hussey can't get this through the covers
Samuels to Hussey, no run excellent stuff from Samuels as this one is only bunted to mid-on
Roach to Hussey, no run good yorker and dug out back to the bowler
Roach to Hussey, no run played square into the off side
Roach to Hussey, OUT West Indies right on top now. In the channel outside off from Roach, Hussey pushed without much footwork and got a thin edge to the keeper
Roach to Bailey, no run defends his first ball in ODIs back to the bowler from off stump
Roach to Bailey, no run beaten outside off, good pace from Roach and Bailey fences at the delivery which doesn't carry through to Baugh
Roach to Bailey, no run back of a length and defended to the off side
Samuels to Hussey, no run tight leave. Angled across the left hander and it wasn't miles away from off stump
Samuels to Hussey, no run
Samuels to Hussey, 2 runs low full toss outside off and it's driven through the covers
Samuels to Hussey, no run defended off the back foot towards point
Samuels to Hussey, 2 runs dragged down a little short and wide this time, Hussey waits then places his cut wide of backward point
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run floated up a touch fuller, draws the batsman forward and there's some deft placement from Hussey to find a gap at cover
Roach to Bailey, 1 run a full toss and the batsman swats it towards midwicket, didn't look to put it beyond the boundary
Roach to Christian, no run a slower ball bowled short of a length outside off, played to short third man
Roach to Christian, 1 leg bye Christian tries to pull a ball that's too full to be pulled and gets hit on the body, he manages to recover and run a quick leg bye

Roach to Bailey, FOUR runs edged and four! Roach bowled a low full toss outside off stump, the batsman backed away and tried to hit through the off side, he got an inside edge between the keeper and short fine leg
Roach to Bailey, FOUR runs another one to the third man boundary! Bailey gets a lot more bat on this one after backing away towards leg, cutting past the fielder at short third man

Roach to Bailey, no run Roach bowls a swinging yorker and has Bailey in a tangle, the ball goes close on the leg side but Roach doesn't pick up after he rushed across, Bailey was a fair way out of his crease. That ball hit Bailey flush on the boot, looked a good lbw shout

Bravo to Christian, FOUR runs the slower ball on a hittable length and Christian swings hard, powering the ball to the square leg boundary where the fielder fails to stop it and then has to hurdle the advertisement hoardings
Bravo to Christian, 2 runs width outside off stump and Christian cuts towards deep point
Bravo to Christian, no run a slower ball in the blockhole, played back to the bowler
Bravo to Christian, FOUR runs too full and on the pads, the yorker gone wrong, Christian swings and gets a bit of an inside edge that takes the ball to the fine leg boundary
Bravo to Christian, 1 run driven towards long off for a single
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run Bailey backs away and swings across the line, slogging the ball towards deep midwicket
Russell to Hussey, 1 run tucked off the pads
Russell to Bailey, no run played square on the off side
Russell to Bailey, no run cramped for room, he shaped to cut but was close to the body so could only defend to point
Russell to Bailey, 1 run tucked into the leg side
Russell to Hussey, no run back of a length on middle and off, defended into the off side...Russell hitting the splice quite hard in this over
Russell to Hussey, no run on off stump, defended square into the off side and that completes a good comeback over by Russell
Samuels to Bailey, 1 run taken from outside off stump and tucked into the gap at square leg
Samuels to Hussey, no run tossed up on middle and leg, comes onto the front foot and defended to cover
Samuels to Hussey, 2 runs on leg stump, worked through short fine leg
Samuels to Hussey, no run beaten! Nicely bowled. It turned quite sharply to beat the outside edge as he played foward
Samuels to Hussey, 2 runs neatly placed through the off side and there's an rare misfield from Pollard at cover which allows a couple
Samuels to Hussey, no run comes round the wicket for the final, it's a touch short and Hussey cuts but picks out point

Roach to Bailey, OUT Bailey's fallen two short of a half-century on debut. He backed away towards leg to create room and hit on the off side. He ended up scooping the ball high in the air and the fielder from the cover-point boundary came in to take a well-judged catch
Roach to Christian, 1 run a full and straight delivery, hit from the crease to deep midwicket
Roach to Lee, 1 run short of a length and straight, Lee takes one hand off the bat and turns his head away from the ball as he fends at it
Roach to Christian, 1 run in the blockhole around off stump, dug out towards midwicket
Roach to Lee, 1 run Lee plays another short of a length delivery awkwardly
Roach to Christian, no run a low full toss outside off, a slower one as well, the batsman swung too early and was beaten
Bravo to Lee, 1 run short of a length, slow again, played off the back foot on the off side
Bravo to Christian, 1 run hit from the crease towards long off
Bravo to Lee, 2 runs the batsman backs away and swings, aiming for deep midwicket, the ball tails into him and the inside edge goes towards fine leg

Bravo to Lee, OUT caught by Johnson Charles, who was running in from deep midwicket. Bravo delivered another slow offcutter that gripped the pitch, Lee was through his leg-side swing too early and mis-hit it high in the air. The fielder judged the catch well on the move
Bravo to Christian, no run Christian charges and slogs at a slower ball delivered from round the wicket, he was beaten
Bravo to Christian, 1 leg bye the batsman misses the heave on the leg side and gets hit on the pad by another slower ball, Australia finish with 204

1.05 pm Australia have been restricted to 204 for 8 on a pitch that is slow and has turn for the spinners. Sunil Narine thrived on the surface, restricting the run flow with Marlon Samuels and Kemar Roach. Dwayne Bravo picked up three wickets. West Indies have not beaten Australia in an ODI since the group stages of the 2006 Champions Trophy. They have a good chance

Welcome back to the second half of this one-day international. Gnasher here for the first part of the chase. West Indies probably marginal favourites, but it won't be easy on a slow pitch. Meanwhile, here's Brydon Coverdale's report from the first innings.
Brett Lee with the new ball...
Lee to Powell, no run outside off, left alone and carries at waist-height to Matthew Wade
Lee to Powell, 1 run touch of extra bounce outside off, he rides it well and guides the ball to third man to open the scoring
Lee to Charles, no run beaten first up, shapes away nicely from the right hander and curves past the outside edge...slightly tentative footwork from Charles
Lee to Charles, no run good line on off stump and decent pace, defends from the crease and point does the fielding
Lee to Charles, 1 wide swings down the leg side but had started on the wrong line as well...the umpire gets to stretch his arms
Lee to Charles, FOUR runs fetch that! Dismissive way to get off the mark as he picks this up from outside off stump and swings it through midwicket. Nice way to treat Brett Lee.
Lee to Charles, 1 run targets the leg side again, but this time doesn't connect as cleanly as he pulls a good-length delivery from off stump to deep square-leg. Certainly not playing Lee's reputation
McKay to Charles, no run his first delivery doesn't bounce much on off stump and Charles jabs down to keep it out
McKay to Charles, no run angled towards the legs, Charles shapes to pull it away but misses out and it strikes the pads
McKay to Charles, FOUR runs a fraction of width offered up and he takes advantage with a stand-and-deliver square drive which threads the gap between point and cover
McKay to Charles, FOUR runs driven on the up, fine start by Charles. Was full outside off and he drilled it past mid-off with a high follow through. Well balanced
McKay to Charles, no run now he's back in defence to a delivery on off stump
McKay to Charles, no run banged in a bit shorter, Charles' eyes light up at the prospect of a pull but he slightly loses his shape on the shot and misses out
Lee to Powell, no run outside off stump and Powell shoulders arms
Lee to Powell, no run pushes this one up a foot further outside off and the batsman isn't interested in playing...looks like he's leaving the shot-making to Charles
Lee to Powell, no run on off stump this time and draws a shot from Powell as he drives to cover
Lee to Powell, no run a nice-looking, punchy drive straight to short cover
Lee to Powell, no run comes onto the front foot and plays with a slightly open face to backward point who leaps to field the field
Lee to Powell, no run not able to find any gaps in that over and it ends with another flowing drive that picks out one of the cover ring
McKay to Samuels, no run good length on off stump, looked like an off-cutter from McKay, and it's defended backward of square on the leg side
McKay to Samuels, no run played into the leg side
McKay to Samuels, no run goes fuller at the stumps and Samuels defends from the crease
McKay to Samuels, 1 run dropped square on the off side with soft hands neither slip or backward point can stop the single
McKay to Powell, 1 run doesn't bounce much outside off stump and Powell plays with an open face to third man
Lee to Powell, no run back of a length on middle and off, Powell camped on the back foot and plays to midwicket
Lee to Powell, no run a bounce from Lee, Powell is through his shot early and is taken on the left shoulder as he swings through
Lee to Powell, FOUR runs lovely shot, big stride forward to a full delivery and drives strongly square through the off side past point
Lee to Powell, no run goes very full, but not quite yorker-length, and it's dug out to mid-on
Lee to Powell, no run moment of good fortune, he aims another booming drive and this time it comes off the inside edge and flies past the stumps to short fine-leg
Lee to Powell, no run excellent yorker to finish with, that was right on target for middle stump but Powell managed to get his feet out of the line and clamp the bat down
McKay to Samuels, no run probing line outside off and this keeps low, Samuels just manages to get an inside on it
McKay to Samuels, no run the batsman is more comfortable in defence this time as he plays to the off side
McKay to Samuels, no run on off stump, Samuels not really getting forward and defends back to the bowler
McKay to Samuels, no run an off-cutter which is played square to point
McKay to Samuels, no run tight stuff now from McKay and Samuels concentrating on defence as he plays into the off side
McKay to Samuels, no run drifts towards middle and leg with the final ball but it doesn't cost anything as Samuels flicks straight to short fine-leg
Lee to Powell, 2 runs continues around the wicket and Powell opens the face fine of third man which means there is a couple available
Lee to Powell, no run starts quite wide outside off and a comfortable leave
Lee to Powell, no run defended into his pads by Powell and it bobbles into the off side
Lee to Bravo, no run leaves his first ball outside off
Lee to Bravo, no run beaten by a really good one. It angled in towards the left hander from around the wicket then nipped away to beat the edge.
McKay to Samuels, no run stays outside off stump, Samuels comes half forward and defends to backward point
McKay to Samuels, no run defends from the crease towards the on side
McKay to Samuels, 1 run goes for a drive and the difficultly in timing on this pitch is shown as it squirts off an inside edge towards square leg
McKay to Bravo, no run defends from around leg stump back to the bowler
McKay to Bravo, no run on off stump, defended with a push to backward point
McKay to Bravo, no run a strangled shout for a catch down the leg side but neither bowler or keeper was at all convinced
Lee to Samuels, no run well bowled, Samuels got into a tangle as he tried to play to the leg side and gets a leading edge into the off side but it went along the ground
Lee to Samuels, no run a much more solid defensive shot this time as he plays into the off side
Lee to Samuels, no run slower ball from Lee and it almost deceived the batsman but he picked it at the last moment and didn't push too hard which could have led to a catch
Lee to Samuels, FOUR runs finds the outside edge, played with soft hands and it runs fine enough to beat a diving third man. Was actually very well controlled by Samuels
Lee to Samuels, no run defended on the back foot
Lee to Samuels, no run defends to backward point
McKay to Bravo, no run he's back the crease and defends with a straight bat towards the bowler
McKay to Bravo, no run worked past short midwicket but mid-on is prowling behind him to prevent any run
McKay to Bravo, no run beats the edge, a pretty loose shot from Bravo as he tries to force it off the back foot but was playing a long way from his body
McKay to Bravo, no run nips back from a good length, takes an inside edge into the pads and rolls towards square leg
McKay to Bravo, no run played towards point
McKay to Bravo, FOUR runs lovely timing and placement, rare poor delivery outside leg stump and Bravo flicks it away with a roll of wrists to comfortably beat deep square
Watson to Samuels, no run defended on the back foot to the bowler
Watson to Samuels, 1 run played towards third man for a single
Watson to Bravo, no run good length and straight, wicket to wicket line, Bravo gets behind it and blocks
Watson to Bravo, no run Bravo defends watchfully on the leg side again
Watson to Bravo, no run fuller ball outside off stump, Bravo drives from his crease but can't get past cover

Watson to Bravo, OUT Bravo's been run out! He pushed the ball off his pads towards wide mid-on and took on Brett Lee, who is a phenomenal athlete even now. Lee swooped on the ball after sprinting to his left and let the throw rip at the stumps at the bowler's end, hitting them with Bravo yards out of his crease. He had played that off his front foot and didn'
Hussey to Bravo, no run a shout for lbw after Bravo tries to defend on the front foot and is hit on the pad, that wasn't hitting, it had spun too much towards leg
Hussey to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Hussey to Bravo, no run played off the back foot
Hussey to Bravo, FOUR runs Bravo goes back and plays a powerful drive through cover, Hussey had dropped a bit too short
Hussey to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Hussey to Bravo, FOUR runs too short once again, Bravo rocks back and pulls the ball in the air and into the gap on the midwicket boundary
Watson to Samuels, no run good length on off and middle, Samuels defends towards the bowler
Watson to Samuels, no run that was a quick ball outside off and Wade appealed confidently for caught behind, while Watson did not. Samuels prodded at a good length ball from his crease and was beaten
Watson to Samuels, 1 run Samuels pushes forward to a fuller ball and gets an edge towards third man
Watson to Bravo, 1 run drops a bit short and Bravo pulls towards long leg with one leg in the air
Watson to Samuels, 1 run played off the pads towards fine leg
Watson to Bravo, no run good length and straight, defended towards the bowler
Hussey to Samuels, no run tossed up from round the wicket, played to midwicket on the front foot
Hussey to Samuels, no run a full toss and Samuels glances it towards fine leg
Hussey to Samuels, no run Samuels moves forward to defend a flat ball on off stump
Hussey to Samuels, 1 run turned off the pads towards fine leg
Hussey to Bravo, no run played off the front foot on the off side
Hussey to Bravo, SIX runs a long hop and Bravo has sent the ball far over the deep midwicket boundary with a fierce pull off the back foot, a lot of muscle in that shot
Watson to Samuels, 1 run a full ball swinging into the right-hander, Samuels pushes at it and gets an outside edge behind point
Watson to Bravo, FOUR runs shot! Bravo thrusts on to the front foot, picks up a length ball and blasts it over the head of the fielder at mid-off, he hit that with tremendous flair
Watson to Bravo, no run good length and straight, Bravo defends
Watson to Bravo, FOUR runs short of a length outside off, Bravo gets on to the front foot and plays an eye-catching square drive through point, he hit that ball on the up
Watson to Bravo, no run moves forward and across to play a full ball towards mid-on
Watson to Bravo, no run Bravo strides forward and defends on the off side
Doherty to Samuels, no run bowled full from round the wicket into the right-hander, defended on the off side
Doherty to Samuels, no run pushed from the crease towards mid-on
Doherty to Samuels, SIX runs that's been dropped beyond the long-off boundary! Samuels stepped out of his crease and blasted the ball flat and far, hitting it with a lot of power
Doherty to Samuels, no run driven hard towards the fielder at mid-on
Doherty to Samuels, SIX runs he's done it again, this time hitting hit over the bowler's head for a six, he stepped out of his crease as the ball angled into him and hit it inside out almost

Doherty to Samuels, SIX runs that's the biggest of them all, Samuels has stepped out of his crease, got to the pitch of the ball, and lofted it straight over the bowler's head again, I don't think we'll be seeing Doherty during the Powerplay any more
Watson to Bravo, no run good length on off, defended on the front foot
Watson to Bravo, no run fuller length on middle and leg, played off the pads to square leg
Watson to Bravo, no run defended towards the bowler, that was slightly in the air but dropped short of Watson on his follow through
Watson to Bravo, no run that's not short enough to pull and Bravo mis-times it to mid-on
Watson to Bravo, no run pushed off the front foot towards point, they think about the single but decide against it
Watson to Bravo, no run good length and straight, Bravo gets behind the line and defends
Christian to Samuels, no run the slower ball on a good length outside off, Samuels gets beaten as he plays off the front foot
Christian to Samuels, no run Samuels strides forward and defends towards point
Christian to Samuels, no run good length angling into off stump again, Samuels defends from his crease
Christian to Samuels, no run this time Samuels strides forward and shoulders arms, Christian got that ball to move towards the keeper's right, but after it passed the batsman
Christian to Samuels, no run he lets another one go outside off stump
Christian to Samuels, no run defended from the crease towards the off side
Doherty to Bravo, FOUR runs and Bravo welcomes him, whipping the ball off his pads and over the head of the fielder at midwicket, he came a long way out of his crease to hit that
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run played towards long-off for a single
Doherty to Samuels, no run Doherty drifts the ball into the right-hander from round the wicket, pitches on middle, and rips it across the outside edge of Samuels' forward defence, superb ball
Doherty to Samuels, no run Samuels plays the ball towards short fine leg
Doherty to Samuels, no run played off the pads on the leg side
Christian to Bravo, no run good length and straight, Bravo defends on the front foot
Christian to Bravo, 1 run width outside off stump and Bravo plays a flamboyant square drive, freeing his arms and swinging with a flourish
Christian to Samuels, no run middle stump line, Samuels gets behind it and blocks
Christian to Samuels, 1 run Samuels goes back and opens the face to steer a short of a length ball towards third man
Christian to Bravo, 1 run Bravo opens the face this time to steer to third man
Christian to Samuels, no run full length and straight, defended back to the bowler
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Bravo, no run that ball has jumped off the pitch away from the right-hander, big turn, and Wade does well to collect
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Bravo, 4 byes that's a huge heave from the batsman and he's connected with nothing, the ball pitched middle and turned past off, just missing the stumps, it beat the keeper as well
Doherty to Bravo, no run played off the front foot
Doherty to Bravo, no run defended on the off side
Christian to Samuels, no run defended with soft hands to backward point
Christian to Samuels, no run driven firmly but straight to mid-off
Christian to Samuels, no run tight lines from Watson and it's played off the front foot to cover

Christian to Samuels, FOUR runs well, you don't see that very often from Australia...Shane Watson has let a ball through his legs at mid-off which has gifted West Indies a boundary. Was a well-time drive, but Watson should have stopped it
Christian to Samuels, no run played from the crease to the leg side
Christian to Samuels, no run opens the face to backward point...would have been maiden without that misfield
Doherty to Bravo, no run nicely flighted on off stump, turns a little and is defended to cover
Doherty to Bravo, no run played into the covers
Doherty to Bravo, no run half an appeal from Wade but no-one else as Samuels comes forward and is taken on the pad...going down the leg side with the angle
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run driven out to the cover sweeper
Doherty to Samuels, 1 run hops onto the back foot and places this through the covers
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run flicked through the leg side wide of midwicket
Christian to Bravo, no run off-cutter outside off stump which is played to backward point
Christian to Bravo, no run good length, accurate from Christian, and it's defended to the bowler
Christian to Bravo, no run worked to midwicket and can't beat the man inside the circle
Christian to Bravo, no run he's keeping it simple, on a length around off stump, and it's again defended

Christian to Bravo, OUT and there's his reward! A lovely delivery from Christian, another off-cutter which bites in the surface and zips between bat and pad to take off stump. Bit of a loose shot, but credit to the bowler for his consistency. Just what Australia needed as West Indies had settled nicely with this stand
Christian to Pollard, no run defended comfortably to midwicket
Doherty to Samuels, no run angled in towards the right hander who defends coming forward
Doherty to Samuels, no run driven to mid-on

Doherty to Baugh, no run we have a review from Australia against Baugh first ball. Appeal for lbw as he's beaten on the back foot and it's given not out. Doesn't look out, missing leg stump? Well, it's just clipping the outside of leg stump so the on-field call stands
Doherty to Baugh, no run played to the on side
Christian to Pollard, no run beaten outside off stump as he tries to guide this square through the off side
Christian to Pollard, 1 run loses his line down the leg side, Pollard connects well with his flick but picks out fine leg
Christian to Russell, no run plays back and defends
Christian to Russell, 1 run onto the front and pushes out to the cover sweeper
Christian to Pollard, no run takes the pad and a strangled shout from Christian...replays confirm it was going down the leg side
Christian to Pollard, 1 run driven firmly into the covers
Doherty to Pollard, no run flighted on middle and leg, straightens and touch and is defended to the on side. How long can Pollard resist?
Doherty to Pollard, no run pushed out to midwicket from a leg-stump line
Doherty to Pollard, no run on the back foot and driven to cover
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run finds the gap this time with an open face this and the sweeper is in action
Doherty to Russell, no run slightly quicker this time and defended off the back foot by Russell
Christian to Pollard, 1 run worked out to deep square leg
Christian to Sammy, no run full outside off and pushed firmly to cover
Christian to Sammy, no run dabbed into the off side
Christian to Sammy, 1 run back of a length, driven towards mid-off and they set off for the single straight away so even if David Hussey had hit direct he was safe
Christian to Narine, no run outside off and left alone
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run touch short from Doherty, gives Sammy time to go onto the back foot and drive out to deep cover
Doherty to Narine, no run round the wicket, on off stump, defended on the front foot
Doherty to Sammy, no run onto the front foot and defends with bat and pad together
Doherty to Sammy, no run nearly does with this one which scoots through quick and it's defended off the back foot
Doherty to Sammy, SIX runs Sammy succeeds where Narine failed by driving this comfortably into the stands at long-off...effortless strike
Lee to Roach, no run round the wicket, starts with a bouncer that sails over Roach's back
Lee to Roach, no run banged in short again, Roach goes onto the back foot and defends down in front of short leg
Lee to Roach, 1 wide pushed too far outside leg stump and an easy call for a wide
Lee to Roach, no run back over the wicket, short of a length on off stump and defended to the covers
Lee to Roach, 1 run nicely played off the back foot with an open face and soft hands towards backward point
Lee to Sammy, no run aims for the yorker and it comes out as a low full toss which is clipped to mid-on
Lee to Sammy, 1 run inside edge past leg stump means he keeps the strike
Doherty to Sammy, SIX runs and the first ball is dispatched into the stands. Dragged down very short by Doherty and Sammy pulls it high over deep midwicket
Doherty to Sammy, FOUR runs well struck again by Sammy - a hint of anger in these shots - as he goes down on one knee and slog-sweeps it flat through midwicket
Doherty to Sammy, no run quicker and flatter, tucked into the leg side
Doherty to Sammy, FOUR runs uses his feet, doesn't quite get it out of the middle but it's struck well enough wide of mid-on...late counter-attack from Sammy
Doherty to Sammy, no run pushed into the off side
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run he manages to keep the strike again by working this away
Lee to Sammy, no run aims for a full, swinging yorker which is dug out to the leg side
Lee to Sammy, FOUR runs a good short ball and it costs Lee four...bounced and nipped into Sammy then took the inside edge which flew past Wade

Lee to Sammy, 1 run missed chance, he gets away with a big top edge this time...another good bouncer that cramps him for room, Sammy goes for the pull and Doherty from short fine-leg can't steady himself under the chance and doesn't even get a hand on it
Lee to Roach, no run back in the crease and defends
Lee to Roach, no run on off stump, solidly defended to the covers...Roach has shown batting ability in the past
Lee to Roach, no run strikes Roach with a well-directed short ball. Not very well played as he took his eye off it and takes a blow on the shoulder
McKay to Sammy, 1 wide starts with a slower-ball gone wrong that loops out well wide of off stump
McKay to Sammy, SIX runs he has plenty of power and picks this up from a good length outside off, sending it over the midwicket boundary again

So that just about wraps things up for today. The second match is on Sunday and we'll see if West Indies can bounce back. But don't forget the third day of New Zealand-South Africa starts shortly and we'll have full coverage on ESPNcricinfo. For now, though, it's goodbye from Andrew McGlashan and George Binoy.
I'll bring you the presentation shortly, and Brydon's match report will be here.

Australia, though, will be delighted with the winning start on a tricky surface. The batting wasn't and its best but they mustered a decent total. Early wickets then gave them a lift then Doherty responded superbly from a tough first over that cost 18.

So Australia win by a comfortable 64 runs after a pretty miserable batting performance from West Indies who gifted most of their wickets. Marlon Samuels and Dwayne Bravo had laid a platform but it disintegrated in the blink of an eye. It raises familiar questions about West Indies' batting stocks and there is plenty of work to do ahead of the second match on Sunday.
Australia won by 64 runs
Player of the match is George Bailey, AUS
